intro: Sporobolus fastigiatus, commonly known as silverleaf grass, is a perennial grass native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Botanically, it is notable for its ability to form dense mats, which can help prevent soil erosion in dry landscapes.
